channel.title: Help with 2D game
channel.description:
(yes this was the post about if statements, ive jsut edited it, oherwise it'll be classed as spam.)
Anyway, i need help creating a 2D game, nothing good, maybe something like an fps
I don't want to be spoonfed, just like guide to some useful things, and things that will help my development.
Like, how to make a client a server, the basic map etc...
Thanks guys, i really appreciate it!!
~Johno

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

xEnt:

so what, in 15 years we’ve gone from wolfenstein 3D to crysis. what could you possibly see in 15 years from now? i doubt there will be much more than what crysis is now tbh, maybe some ray tracing

I’m sure people back then didn’t think it could get more advanced than wolfenstein 3d back then. I clearly remember the first time I played doom I was amazed at how real the world looked, like a virtual reality or something. I never noticed how all the walls were square and all the sprites were 2d, I thought it was the pinnacle of 3d gaming. Who knows what is to come, I’m sure it will be great though.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:35, topic:294654”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=389717.msg2938195#msg2938195 date=1251685915]
It actually isn’t. The environment is 3d, but all of the monsters and indeed every sprite is 2d.
[/quote]

If you replace the monsters in Duke Nukem 3D with 2D sprites, it’s still a 3D game. Just because the monsters are 2D, doesn’t mean there isn’t a third dimension.[/quote]

I think Duke Nukem 3D used 2D sprites and stuff as well, although I hardly played it so I don’t know for sure. Wolfenstein3D used 2d sprites. I’m just saying that it isn’t a real 3D game like we think of one today, in wolfenstein and doom for example you couldn’t even jump, so 2D movement combined with 2D sprites, combined with a world that looks 3D, I don’t know what kind of game that makes.

Read full topic

duke nukem? i thought it was duke bean em…lol

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @light232 light232
item.description:
@light232 wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:22, topic:294654”][quote author=PeeHPee link=topic=389717.msg2910449#msg2910449 date=1250051714]

usingXBow();

how about reading the java tutorial by sun?

I would, but tbh, i have a sort concentration span, i hate reading the TuTs from java because there all one colour on a white background… Borring… Lolz[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 11, 2009, 09:23:26 pm[/size][hr][quote author=la­wl link=topic=389717.msg2910385#msg2910385 date=1250047147]
usingXBow();

how about reading the java tutorial by sun?

Also, where would i add that and how much more do i need to add to the int?
[/quote]
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,66248.0.html, one if them is bound to be colourful.
[/quote]

Hmm, this is going to be harder then i expected… So, what statement would i use then? So it tells me when my bow is equipped, ive equipped it, and when ive unequipped it. it tells me!

This would be awesome if i could work this out (With ur help) i would be taking a leep in the write direction!!! Not staying in mopar refeshing my mind on how to copy and paste…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 12, 2009, 08:09:24 am[/size][hr][quote author=BAsh link=topic=389717.msg2910478#msg2910478 date=1250053867]

Im fed up of ripping other peoples code and changing some shit, i wanna code my own, from scratch, even if all it does is say i equipped/unequipped a bow!

This is a first from moparscape.
[/quote]

Maybe it is. You know what, im going to stop with RSp servers, there hard to code (Advanced java) thats why mostly all of them suck like a peace of shit.

Im going to learn java, and create some games, nothing good, just something that’ll ill learn from.

First things first, where do i start? ^^[/quote]
rofl RSPS IS ADVANCED JARBA?
/fail

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @soul_raever soul raever
item.description:
@soul_raever wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:32, topic:294654”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=389717.msg2937278#msg2937278 date=1251636304]

Is it even possible to make a 2D fps?

Yeh, ive seen them at freeonlinegames, quite a few of them! I want to try and create one, but have no idea where to start

Can you link me to a 2d fps then? What I’m trying to say is that 2d shooters are always side scrolling. You can go up/down, and left/right. In a fps, you can go up/down, left/right AND forward/backward. So there are 3 dimensions.

doom…
nuff said

Doom is 3D.
[/quote]

It actually isn’t. The environment is 3d, but all of the monsters and indeed every sprite is 2d.[/quote]
yea the game is kinda fake 3d

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Duck hunt is so near a 2D FPS you can get.

Problem with FPS is that in 99.999% (Yes a random number) cases it uses some sort of 3D it is impossible to avoid if you want a good game.

Make a 3rd Person shooter, that is either side scrolling or top view.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:

[quote=“johno2, post:25, topic:294654”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=389717.msg2918514#msg2918514 date=1250620301]
Is it even possible to make a 2D fps?
[/quote]

Yeh, ive seen them at freeonlinegames, quite a few of them! I want to try and create one, but have no idea where to start :D[/quote]

Can you link me to a 2d fps then? What I’m trying to say is that 2d shooters are always side scrolling. You can go up/down, and left/right. In a fps, you can go up/down, left/right AND forward/backward. So there are 3 dimensions.

item.title: Help with 2D game
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

degenerate:

It should, but there is a better way of doing this. Perhaps, in your “weildmethod”, there is already a block of code that contains item IDs and sends messages depending on whether the item is worn or not…

Im fed up of ripping other peoples code and changing some shit, i wanna code my own, from scratch, even if all it does is say i equipped/unequipped a bow!

la­wl:

it wont say you took the bow off, you have to call the function when the bow is equiped or unequiped

How would i call “this” Function?

Read full topic
